title: Ticket #915: schedd memory leak?
description:
It sure looks like there's something that's happening rarely (log rotation?), that's triggering a problem of bloating the schedd some.

Details in associated RUST ticket.
remarks:
2009-Nov-05 17:05:24 by tannenba:
Greg, please send a note on the ticket telling Joe what you'd like him to do... the ball is in our court. Seems like asking him how long he ran the Google heap tracer and/or asking him to run it for a longer period of time would be good.

Joe was not on the phone call I had this morning w/ Fermi folks, but he is still concerned about it.

2009-Nov-09 11:54:06 by gthain:
I've updated the rust ticket.

It sure looks like a memory leak, but it is almost certainly something specific to fnal. No one else has any leak like this.

I've talked to Fermi, they are still running 7.2, haven't changed anything, but the leak seems to have gone away. Resolving.
